verses.roman:
dakṣiṇa deśera loka aneka prakāra
keha jñānī, keha karmī, pāṣaṇḍī apāra

synonyms: dakṣiṇa deśera—of South India; loka—people; aneka—many; prakāra—varieties; keha—someone; jñānī—philosophical speculator; keha—someone; karmī—fruitive worker; pāṣaṇḍī—nondevotees; apāra—innumerable.
translation: In South India there were many types of people. Some were philosophical speculators, and some were fruitive workers, but in any case there were innumerable nondevotees.
